snippet: In an area with one of the city’s highest number of liquor licenses, a host of criminal activities bolster the idea that Times Square’s former seediness has found a new home.
abstract: Roosevelt Avenue in Queens, home to vices including prostitution, public drunkenness and counterfeiting, has proved resistant to New York City's decades-long cleanup effort; long-running battle for the avenue reveals the adaptive abilities of certain criminal industries that are reduced in one area only to pop up in another.
lead_paragraph: In an area with one of the city’s highest number of liquor licenses, a host of criminal activities bolster the idea that Times Square’s former seediness has found a new home.

headline.seo: On Roosevelt Avenue in Queens, Vice Remains a Stubborn Presence
headline.main: Roosevelt Avenue, a Corridor of Vice
